title: Update splash screen company name font and add color styling

requirements.summary: Apply a stylized display font to the splash screen company name text without changing copy or behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: On the splash screen, the company name text renders with a clearly different font style than the current default (e.g., a display/branding font feel).
The company name text remains exactly: "STAR MAHARASHTRA GALAXY INTERNET" (spelling/case/wording unchanged).
The splash screen continues to auto-transition, fade out, and allow skipping as before.

file_operations.description: Load a chosen display/branding webfont (e.g., via hosted font stylesheet links in <head>) so the splash company name can reliably render in a non-default stylized font while keeping all text English-only and preserving existing splash behavior.

Extend Tailwind fontFamily with a dedicated display font stack (e.g., fontFamily.display) that uses the newly loaded webfont with sensible fallbacks, enabling consistent styling for the splash company name.

Update the company name <h1> styling to use the new Tailwind display font class (keeping the rendered text exactly "STAR MAHARASHTRA GALAXY INTERNET") and ensure no changes to the existing auto-transition, fade-out, or skip interactions.

requirements.summary: Add clearly noticeable multi-color/gradient styling to the splash screen company name while leaving the tagline unchanged and honoring reduced-motion behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: The company name text displays visible color styling (multi-color or gradient) across the words, and the result is clearly noticeable.
The tagline remains exactly: "Connect to the Future with Internet at Light Speed." and remains readable against the background.
In reduced-motion mode (`prefers-reduced-motion: reduce`), the new font and color styling still apply, and animations remain disabled as currently implemented.

file_operations.description: Add CSS rules for the existing splash word span classes (e.g., .splash-word-star/.splash-word-maharashtra/.splash-word-galaxy/.splash-word-internet) to apply multi-color styling (per-word colors or a text gradient effect) that remains readable on the splash background; ensure reduced-motion media query continues to disable animations while still applying the new font/color styling.

Adjust company-name markup/classes only as needed to support the new multi-color/gradient styling (e.g., ensure span classes are retained/used and do not affect the tagline); keep existing reduced-motion logic and the splash timing/transition/skip behavior unchanged.
